cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ESE of Cayo Largo, Cuba and 165 mi SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across west-central Cuba today, then turning north-northwest toward the Florida Keys tonight and tracking along/near Florida’s west coast toward the Tampa Bay area Tuesday night–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of the Tampa Bay area on Florida’s west coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: West coast of Florida from Englewood northward to the Aucilla River, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: West coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood; Florida Keys Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida west coast from the Keys through the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds 40–60 mph with higher gusts possible Tuesday night through Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 2–4 ft above normal tides possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated pockets up to 6 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous seas/swells affecting port approaches
